A játékmenetre nem lehet panasz, mert egyszerűen élvezet vele játszani. A pályák pedig szintén tökéletesek! Kár, hogy csak három van. :( Mondjuk egy egyjátékos kampányt elbírt volna a játék, na meg persze történet, hogy pontosan kik vagyunk mi és miért dobálunk egymásnak frizbiket.

This is a very deep and emotional game. First off, it has a wonderful story, up there with such games as Skyrim, Half-Life, and Borderlands. It tells the story of a future America where the only way that people can advance in society is to play a game of life or death. This game they are forced to play in front of thousands of power hungry people is the only way to make it. The protaganist of this game is forced to fight his way through the arena, beating every level, and eventually fighting his way to the boss MechObama. It is a very satisfying game and I recommend it to all.

An absolute pleasure to play through. Ricochet goes where no other Valve game has ever been before - You take control of Pert Kravelski, another overlooked escapee of the Black Mesa Research Facility introduced in Valve's hit title "Half-Life" whose goal throughout the entire game is to discover the Saisei code (which I won't spoil for you who don't know what that is).

Since Pert's family was kidnapped by the Task Force which invaded the Black Mesa Research Facility in Half-Life, his goal is to break into the barracks of the Task Force and retreive his family, after wasting each and every soldier in the facility, but there is an extremely poetic, creative and unexpected plot-twist which prevents you from doing so (this is the meat of the story)

The game runs unbelievably smooth for the time it was made, and the graphics are just stunning. I can't fathom why the Valve fanbase completely dismissed this game, as its feature-set, physics, *and* graphics rival that of Half-Life 2. 

Buy. This. Game.

Ricochet is a multiplayer deathmatch game, which attempts to be original and has virtual/arcade feel to it. It was a free modification for Half-Life, coming along with one of the patches to the game, and from what I know, it was supposed to show new additions to the engine, as well as just being a bonus. Yet now it's being sold on Steam serapately. And in this case, it wasn't a good move.

And well... Player base of this multiplayer game is dead. Completely. And is the main reason not to recommend this for purchase.

Otherwise, the game is not horrible. It was good for what it was supposed to be - bonus mod. You jump between platforms using boosters and throw discs at opponents, either to push them off into void or to kill them. You regenerate discs ammo all time up to 3 of them. Pushing requires 1 discs, thus can be spammed. Decapating disc wastes all 3 "ammo". There is regular respawning power-up. And with usage of HL Engine advanced maneuvering (air strafing) you can try to outsmart enemies by landing on different platform than what is expected.
And most often, you will fall into void due to your own clunkyness. Or bump into another player and fall down together.
It's just that it tried to push on art direction of "arcade/virtual" style too much, thus it lacks any casual fun of "shoot them the terrorists from awesome guns", nor does it has any pleasent art in levels themselves.
Otherwise, nice bonus mod, for 2-4 players DMing.

Ricochet is a long forgotten classic. Created by Valve, this game is truly what revolutionized multiplayer gameplay. As a proud member of the Elite 420_XXX_Richochet Club, I can concur that this game is better than most online multiplayer-centric deathmatch games around. With it's detailed graphics, and high-quality sound, Richochet is a game for the ages. I have successfully noscoped 666 noobs with my powerful disc skillz. The game is very good. Sacrifice your soul to great Cthulhu himself to witness the holy glory that is Ricochet.

This is a sarcastic review of a video game product. This sarcastic review is directed at a dated game that computer software game developer "Valve" made named Ricochet. I say how this is better than another computer software game "Valve" has made that is named "Half Life 2", which has been commended for its very high production quality. I, of course, intend such in mocking jest. I also reference "Shrek", an animated movie made by movie studio "Dreamworks". This movie has been praised by children and adults alike due to the correct balancing of humor and plot in said movie. I am making this comment once again in jest, because the movie also has a somewhat unsettling following that has been made near memetic qualities due to popularity. I end up finishing off my review with a mockingly optimistic rating of 10 out of 10.

This game was literally life-changing. I cannot stop playing this game. I would let my hours speak for me, but I would rather ramble on how amazing this game is. 

TL;DR If this game was a person I would bend her over. 

Firstly, let's talk about the plot. A glorious twist on the famous franchise 'Half-Life', Gordon now has the ability to talk and must lead his army against the vast Black Mesa... in space. The introduction of new characters such as Chell from Portal and the SWAT team from Counter-Strike: Global Offensive really improved the quality of this story. I won't try to spoil the plot, but there is a very dramatic death scene towards the end of the game (you'll know when it happens). If you've ever seen a person quote "Et tu Brute?", those were the actually words of the final boss. Again, the main campaign was fantasic, I played it through at least 5 times.

Secondly, the gameplay mechanics. The controls are so natural, I felt as if I was Gordon. I kid you not, I went to the hospital because my mom thought I was bats**t insane. I'm not insane, unless you consider that I am bats**t insane for this game. Throwing the frisbee, feels like actually throwing a frisbee. I had to take a break after my first 3 minutes of gameplay, because my shoulder was hurting from the recoil of throwing. BUT THERE'S SO MANY FRISBEEs! :D Do you prefer fast? Done. Do you rather use three? Done. Knife? Done. Anything else? Done. You can literally kill them with anything. Think GTA V, but better.

Thirdly, the community. Believe it or not, Ricochet has the largest community and more online players than any other game. After 2 weeks of the release, it broke every single record with community involvement. That's pretty impressive. I once got into a game and was playing for maybe 10 hours when someone decided to randomly give me a bunch of *ok* games (skirym, Day y, Team Fort 3). Is there any other game where someone just randomly decides to give you free money? That's what I thought. And that is the Ricochet difference.

To summarize, this game is visually and mechanically stunning, it is definitely worth every cent that you earned to spend it on this game. To be serious, this should be Game of the Year, every year. To be actually serious, if you wasted your time to read this far in a bs review, than you would probably enjoy wasting your time on this deserted game.

After one whole hour of playing this game, I can honestly say that I have been blown away. This game is one of the greatest ever made, with super realistic graphics, sounds, and decapitation physics. Everything is perfect. I can finally quench my thirst to send the 2 other people in the world who actually play this masterpiece into an endless, spinning void. Ten out of ten, Valve. You have done it again.

Scrap Halflife 2, portal, team fortress - This is where the fun is at, ask me, name another game where you can throw frisbees at a man in space, and them watch him scream as he falls into an eternal void? Or perhaps you'd like to watch him be decapitated in a whole 3 frames of animation! And with a wide variety of 1 map you won't be getting bored any time soon! So jump right in, and browse the empty servers as you try desperately to get your money's worth! This game is the best of the best.
